result.execSummary:
The defendant Sameeh J Pickens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

No contact with the victim, D.S. (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including domestic violence and relationship training. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes:
*CORRECTED 12-11-2017:  *With Huber for employment, including time to care for his bees, and child care. *  DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.   ** AMENDED 12-06-2017:  Report in date amended, as well as length of jail time. **   

***AMENDED 12-06-2017:   May be served in Waukesha County jail under the condition that the defendant not be released on electronic monitoring.***

AMENDED 01-18-2018: MAY SERVE IN WALWORTH COUNTY JAIL OR WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL. MAY NOT BE RELEASED ON ELM. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE HUBER TO CARE FOR HIS BEES AND FOR CHILD CARE.

filed by Atty De Peters (from Defendant's future employer)

Court Reporter:  Leslie Johnson. Defendant Sameeh J Pickens in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   on Motion on Postconviction Relief.

Atty DePeters provided copy of additional letter regarding employment opportunity in Whitewater.   She spoke with defendant's current agent who indicated he has been compliant with probation.  No new factor, but odd circumstances in this case.  They are requesting in the alternative increased time for Huber, and to serve sentence in Waukesha.

State agrees that report in date should be 2018 rather than 2019.  Objects to removing original jail sentence.  Feels original sentence is appropriate.  No objection to Huber for child care or adjustment for hours for employment.  
Statement by the Defendant. 

BTC:  Sentence modified to 3 months RCJ (rather than 6); Huber for beekeeping & child care.  May be served in Waukesha but no electronic monitoring. Report-in date changed to 1-11-18.   Atty DePeters to prepare the order from today.

Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley. Defendant Sameeh J Pickens in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Sameeh J Pickens in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On request for bond modification.

Atty Hamad indicates a bond modification would allow defendant to minimun/work release program, is currently at Fox Lake.  
State objects to any bond modification.  

BTC:  Presumption of innocence no longer in existance.  Defendant has prior bailjumpings, however now misdemeanors.  

Girlfriend is Tonya Ann Cramer who would co-sign bond, she was in court, employed, and willing to co-sign.  She was advised of responsibilies/dangers that go along with co-signing bond.  

BTC:  Bond reduced to $5,000 - $1000 cash & $4000 to be co-signed by girlfriend, all other conditions remain, especially no contact with victim.
